Slack

Group Product Manager, Productivity

Remote, US from 2/21/2021

Responsible for the 1~2 year product vision and strategy for how teams and individuals better prioritize, organize, and get their work done.
Relied upon by senior leadership as a domain expert in the field of productivity, often presenting to executives your product strategy, execution progress, and contribution to company-wide success metrics.
You will not have a team to manage directly, but will lead a cross-functional team.
Help cross-functional partners, and senior leaders to be aware of down-stream risks and dependencies to be mitigated.
Synthesize customer needs, industry trends, and data to think deeply to create strategies and plans to take us into white-space territory.
Comfortable learning quickly, prototyping rapidly, and shipping incrementally as you discover and find product-market fit.

Sr. Manager, Product Design

San Francisco, CA from 2/21/2021

Leading a team of Product Designers focused on Slack’s anatomy, information architecture, interaction models, our design System SlackKit and accessibility.
Working with product and engineering and other cross-functional partners to drive design vision and strategy. Help turn business objectives into customer centered problems and steer team strategy.
Creating flexible and scalable frameworks and guidelines for other teams and companies to build features on Slack
Designing, guiding and driving collaboration processes.
Setting a high bar for quality and help teams ship with that quality, without compromising velocity
Meeting regularly with designers to provide and gather feedback on project progress
Coaching, mentoring and providing career development, work satisfaction and happiness to your team.
Ensuring that projects are properly staffed based on scope, skills and timing.
Define and drive design hiring goals. Recruit and interview new Product Designers, review incoming candidates, and actively improve our design hiring process.

Sr. Product Manager, Monetization

Remote, US from 2/21/2021

You prioritize the user experience above all else, focused on value creation over value extraction
You’ll develop the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for teams to successfully see the value in our paid features and upgrade to a premium plan
You’ll become an authority on your product area. You’ll identify customer needs and business opportunities through a combination of research, feedback collection from cross-functional teammates and competitive data analysis
You’ll execute at a fast pace with a focus on user experience, impact, and learning
You’ll work with design and engineering partners to ship well-crafted product and appreciate the little big details
You’ll define, understand, and improve key funnels and metrics. You’re excited about the business impact of your work, and can work collaboratively with key stakeholders from finance to go-to-market teams.
You’ll own features and experiments end-to-end, including writing product specs, driving cross-functional execution, making thoughtful product decisions along the way, and sharing insights and results throughout the company.
You’ll drive execution against our plan in collaboration with engineering, design and marketing peers: making trade-offs, anticipating staffing needs, risks, and ensuring frequent and clear communication.

Product Lead, Emerging Products

San Francisco, CA from 2/21/2021

You will own the product vision and strategy for how Slack becomes the essential digital replacement for the physical office. You will constantly identify, evaluate, and pursue new opportunities for products no one had imagined before.
You will focus on building an absolutely delightful user experience above all else. You’ll ship a well-crafted product and sweat the little big details.
You will relentlessly drive the pace and quality of execution with one of the most senior Engineering and Design teams at Slack. You will make hard tradeoffs, de-risk issues, communicate clearly, and inspire the entire company.
You will drive go-to-market – from positioning to packaging to pricing – because as important as building great products for this emerging market will be shaping the rapidly shifting market to these new products.
You will optimize for our pace of learning in an open-ended new space. You will drive rapid prototyping of new ideas, and constantly collect feedback from early releases to customers.
Over time, you will lead and guide the development of a team of amazing product managers and help them do their best work.
You will take on founder-level ownership for the success of our Emerging Products – from driving usage to business impact.
You will frequently act as an external ambassador for Slack with customers, partners, and the press.
You will help shape Slack’s product strategy and development process while we grow, as part of the product leadership team.
